qas.question: What is the largest private foundation in the world?

answers.text: Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation (or the Gates Foundation, abbreviated as BMGF) is the largest private foundation in the world

qas.question: Where is the Bill and Melinda gates foundation based?

answers.text: The foundation, based in Seattle, Washington

qas.question: What is the largest private foundation in America?

plausible_answers.text: The foundation, based in Seattle, Washington

qas.question: Where is the Susan-Desmond Hellmann foundation based?

plausible_answers.text: Bill Gates, Melinda Gates and Warren Buffett

qas.question: What are the names of the trustees for the foundation based in America?

plausible_answers.text: to expand educational opportunities and access to information technology

qas.question: What are the primary goals of the foundation in Seattle?
What does the principal officer Melinda Gates control?

context: <a0_0><b2_0>Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation<b2_0/> (or the Gates Foundation, abbreviated as BMGF) is the largest private foundation in the world<a0_0/>, founded by Bill and Melinda Gates. It was launched in 2000 and is said to be the largest transparently operated private foundation in the world. The primary aims of the foundation are, globally, to enhance healthcare and reduce extreme poverty, and in America, <b5_0>to expand educational opportunities and access to information technology<b5_0/>. <a1_0><b3_0><b6_0>The foundation<b6_0/>, based in Seattle, Washington<b3_0/><a1_0/>, is controlled by its three trustees: <b4_0>Bill Gates, Melinda Gates and Warren Buffett<b4_0/>. Other principal officers include Co-Chair William H. Gates, Sr. and Chief Executive Officer Susan Desmond-Hellmann.
